comments.commentBody: Apparently the Chinese haven't heard the news - it's all a hoax! They don't need to do a thing according to our GOP flunkies. Just keep spewing the worst poison into the atmosphere because at least 2% of the scientists - at least those on the GOP payroll - will explain that none of this is man-made or even the result of any human contribution that could be minimize or stopped. So pollute to your hearts delight China - in a few short months perhaps the GOPers will all join you in a grand party of depraved greed and greenhouse gases.

"China has been developing and carrying out smaller cap-and-trade programs for at least three years. In 2012, it started pilot programs in seven provinces, intended to serve as tests for a national program."

No wonder we are behind. We were kept in the dark until the shock blows us away.

Yeah, sure. I don't believe a word they say. Even so, it doesn't really matter. The planet is burning up, anyone not wrapped up in denial can see it, and the pitiful steps we are taking to deal with it are just cotton candy.

We are toast. Literally.

It will take major disasters worldwide to make the human race wake up to the self-imposed destruction of itself it is cementing with its uncontrolled population growth and lack of will to face the whole picture of what uncontrolled human "stewardship" of the planet is going to leave for our grandkids and their kids, who will suffer the consequences of our extreme negligence when we are safely dead.

"Korea was given over as a spoil of war to the winners, the Soviet Union and the United States. " Lie. Deliberate.

Shoreline

I quote again for those who choose to selectively edit out as they read.

A lot of americans died hard in Korea in a very unpopular, more than Vietnam, "UN" police action. And more koreans, chinese. But also Turks. And Pakistanis. Etc. Mao's son, too. https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mao_Anying. Brought brainwashing into american vernacular,
https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brainwashing,
Which began as self criticism when Mao escaped and hid out during the SinoJapanese war, and ended up PRC thought reform, then Cultural Revolution. Some great stories of eating bitter there, some published in the NYT.

Each of these dead and "reformed" has a story the equal of this writer's so a little respect please by dropping gratuitous PC lies. Why not?
On the other hand, how do we justify unilaterally creating Israel out of Palestinian territory in 1948?

Furthermore: Israel traded back the Sinai to Egypt in exchange for a peace treaty. Israel removed ALL the settlers who had moved into that area -- by force. Peace is far more important to Israelis than settlements.

Roger, as you know, there were no Israeli settlers in the West Bank and Gaza when Israel was created in 1947-48. In fact the Jewish settlers who lived in those areas prior to the partition were killed or driven out. You would also have to explain why the two state solution was rejected by the Arabs and why Israel was  subsequently terrorized, boycotted, attacked, and isolated all before any settlements were ever built in the territories. You would also have to explain that the settlers movement in Israel did not gain momentum until the late 1970s under the Likud, and in spite of that, three successive Israeli prime ministers made peace offers based on 1967 borders all of which were rejected by the Palestinians. It's impossible to make a deal with someone whose only solution to the problem is your demise. A lot of Jews recognize this and while they don't want to rule over another people they believe the Palestinians have left them no other choice.

Discussion about Israel's role in the world leaves out The God Factor.

Palestinian never had ancestral land in Israel.

Until 1948 Jews were called Palestinians in Israel before Palestinians existed.

Would you share your house if strangers demanded it?

Those Arab strangers are called Palestinians. Trans-Jordan was carved out from the Ottoman Empire as a homeland for Palestinians.

Why didn't the Palestinians claim "their" land when Jordan occupied it for 19 years?

They change the game to see what elicits sympathy for their violent actions by playing down their real goal-to wipe Israel off the map.

As Isaiah said "My house of prayer will be a house of prayer for all people."

As the secular Zionists fade away the religious Jews will prove to be as prophesied, "a light unto the nations."

@Jeff, maybe because there were no "expelled Palestinians", rather, there were Arab refugees who fled the fighting from a war that the Arabs started, after rejecting a compromise peace plan (that the Jews accepted).
Well expressed! Thank you.

Listening to the Pope's speech to Congress, I was reminded of the life-shaping lessons I learned way back in Catholic school in the 1960's. There is a right and wrong. It determines how we treat everyone. We are all equal in God's eyes.

It was both comforting because it was so familiar and right, and inspiring because it reminded me that life should be spent becoming a better person.

Roger Cohen should have waited until  Yom Kippur was over and  had a little something to nosh on before writing another column bashing Jews.  Sheesh, we just don't get a break now do we?  Jewish attendance at synagogue always goes up on Yom Kippur because we're gathering for the all important Yizkor services to pay our  respects to our deceased relatives.  In my case that means reciting prayers for the souls of my late father and my late  husband.  There were also prayers memoralizing Jews were killed by terrorists.  Trust me, the Palestinians never came up during the whole service I can tell you that.  Why should it?  Palestinians tried to disrupt the holidays in Jerusalem by throwing rocks as Jews tried to get to high holy day services.  Yeah, they're really suffering.  One little boy expressed his desire to become an engineer to Hamas leaders.  Why did he want to become an engineer? So he could blow up Jews that's why.

China has more wind generation than the US, is building nuclear power plants (let's hope they have their nuclear waste disposal figured out) and is starting to get solar generation going.
The Chinese, unlike the Republicans in this country, know that burning fossil fuel causes global warming, and they have many important cities close to sea level, so they have incentive to stop global warming.

Some economics seem in order for this issue:
1. China's own coal costs approximately USD2.00 per million British thermal units, which is how fuel costs for electricity generation are measured.
2. Natural gas via pipeline from Kazakhstan or China's own fields costs approximately USD7.00 per million BTUs.
3. LNG from Qatar and elsewhere costs approximately USD9-10/mmbtu.

Imports from Kazakhstan or LNG suppliers cost hard forex currency.

Coal is domestic and is bought using RMB.

China is not California.

How credible is the notion that China will increase its electricity generating costs by some multiples when it can save so much and just keep polluting?

Jews were persecuted and even deported from Arab nations where they had lived peacefully for years. These were not Israeli Jews. They were citizens of Arab nations. All their land and property were confiscated. How did they manage to blame that on "settlers in the territories"?

Well, tell me then Roger, why, long before there were settlers,  did Palestinians begin their terrorist and suicide attacks on Israelis? I myself think there have to be controls put on the settlers and arrests must happen to settlers who break the law and worse.  But Netanyahu is only kept on because of such attacks by Palestinians and by frightful rocket attacks from the area (Gaza) they completely (and painfully) departed.  If Israelis could ever feel and see in action, a  desire for Peace and two nations, side by side, they would get rid of their current Prime Minister and his right wing philosophy.
Deadline, all of the above, but mostly twitting.

The GOP sure had a big hole put in their "smoke screen" of denying climate change... that darned liberal Pope and then those Obama-lovin' Chinese.

Seriously, it was only a matter of time before the Chinese had to do something. Those images of Beijing that showed up during The Olympics was proof positive of that.

I must say, though, that National Association of Manufacturers surely anticipated this... a scare commercial about jobs just ran on TV. You know the story; if cleaning up the environment costs any money, it is going to cause us to take away 1.4 million jobs. Petulance doesn't end in elementary school. Maybe the NAM ought to be running these ads in Rome and Beijing, too.
What a sweeper this is.  Jews are quite diverse in this country and in this world.  Thinking that you can define them all is foolish.

Mr. Cohen is right on every point but one.  The world has millions of oppressed and expelled, and Israel, like virtually every other country, does not do enough to welcome strangers into its midst.  It is not, however, obligated to welcome  citizens of of a country with which it is at war.

We will need serious verification protocols and serious ways to make sure they are indeed implementing these lofty agreements, cause you know China is so trustworthy and has such a mature sense of fair play.............so yes there will still be some serious objections.

Cap and trade.  Tell that to the flooded cities, dying arctic wildlife, drought parched continents, threatened species...  its the Volkswagen Diesel chip solution to China being the leader in polluting our planet.

This news is more economic genius than virtuous benevolence.

China's adoption of Cap and Trade will really accelerate their solar industry which is nearly well refined and ready for exponential growth.

The decision to adopt Cap and Trade is just a smart economic business decision that will reignite the meandering Chinese economy.

They have a jump on the system not only with the solar industry, but also the three gorges dam project that will supply enormous amounts of hydroelectric power.

Define "works well"?

Both California and the US northeast have cap-and-trade systems, and their emissions are lower and they are raising money that can be used for other public purposes.
1.3 billion people live there. Be glad.

They HAD to do this!

When China must shut down industry and traffic in order to hold the Olympics or a parade, it isn't a choice. They were slowly poisoning themselves. Good for them that they faced reality, which is more than can be said for so many of our politicians.

As someone who was born into Judaism and practiced an orthodox version of it (but currently practices no religion), part of the problem as I see it IS the idea that EVERYTHING boils down to "practicality" and just being Jew-ish.  On a day of atonement, the holiest of the Jewish year, are "deadlines" and "columns" REALLY important enough to put one's faith on hold while you tend to them?  My problem with Judaism lies right here.  In my view there are things that one should NOT "put on hold" and one of those is a genuine belief, for those that have one, in the concept of "atonement for sins" and the practice of one's faith.  Sorry but the column could have been written by someone else or have waited....you should have STAYED in shul.
One of the headlines might have been "British Government adopts limit to Jewish immigration from Europe, restrictions on Jewish land purchases because of Arab opposition".

Here, here. One of the joys of the internet is getting to enjoy shofars from different synagogues -- they are quite individual -- the noise is truly joyous.

Happy New Year.

The fasting was easy; I smoked my tobacco pipe.
The contractors were here, finishing what should have been done Tuesday ... before Sundown. I posted a sign ---Leave me alone until noon.
I did my morning prayers in my living room; read some supposedly inspiring passages, and finished with my favorite Psalm of David. You know the one.
Atonement? It would have taken longer than one day to accomplish that. (Sigh!)
